1.text: And Jehovah will say to Moses, Carve to thyself two tables of stones like as the first: and I wrote upon the tables the words which were upon the first tables which thou didst brake.

2.text: And be prepared at morning, and come up in the morning to mount Sinai, and stand by me there upon the head of the mount.

3.text: And no man shall come up with thee, and also a man shall not be seen in all the mountain: also the sheep and the cattle shall not feed before that mountain.

4.text: And he will carve the two tables of stones as the first; and Moses will rise early in the morning, and will go up to the mount Sinai as Jehovah commanded him, and he will take in his hand the two stone tables.

5.text: And Jehovah will come down in a cloud, and he will stand with him there, and will call upon the name of Jehovah.

6.text: And Jehovah will pass by before him, and Jehovah will call, Jehovah God merciful and compassionate, deferring anger, and much in kindness and truth,

7.text: Watching kindness for thousands, taking away iniquity, and transgression and sin, and acquitting, will not cleanse; striking the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons and upon the sons’ sons, upon the third and the fourth.

8.text: And Moses will hasten and bow down to the earth, and will worship.

9.text: And he will say, If now I found grace in thine eyes, my lord, my lord will go now in the midst of us (for it is a people of a hard neck) and forgive our iniquity and our sin, and take possession of us.

10.text: And he will say, Behold, I make a covenant before all thy people: and I will do wonders which were not created in all the earth, and in all nations; and all the people where thou art among them saw the work of Jehovah: for it is a fearful thing which I do with thee.

11.text: Watch to thyself what I command thee this day: behold me driving out from before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.

12.text: Watch to thyself lest thou shalt make a covenant with those dwelling in the land which thou goest upon it, lest it shall be for a snare in the midst of thee.

13.text: For their altars thou shalt lay waste, and their pillars thou shalt break, and their images thou shalt cut off.

14.text: For thou shalt not worship another God: for Jehovah, his name is Jealous; he is a jealous God.

15.text: Lest thou shalt make a covenant to those dwelling in the land and they committed fornication after their gods, and sacrificed to their gods, and call to thee, and thou didst eat from his sacrifice;

16.text: And thou didst take from his daughters to thy sons, and they committed fornication after their gods, and they made thy sons commit fornication after their gods.

17.text: Thou shalt make to thee no molten gods.

18.text: The festival of unleavened thou shalt watch. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened, which I commanded thee, for the appointment of the month Abib: for in the month Abib thou earnest forth out of Egypt.

19.text: All opening the womb is to me: all thy cattle, the male, the firstling of the ox or sheep.

20.text: And the first-born of the ass thou shalt redeem with a sheep: and if thou shalt not ransom, thou shalt break his neck. Every first-born of thy sons thou shalt ransom, and he shall not be seen before me empty.

21.text: Six days thou shalt work, and in the seventh day thou shalt cease: and in ploughing and in harvest thou shalt cease.

22.text: And the festival of seven thou shalt make to thee, the first fruits of the harvest of wheat, and the festival of collection of the circuit of the year.

23.text: Three times in the year all thy males shall be seen before the Lord Jehovah, the God of Israel.

24.text: For I will dispossess the nations from before thee; and I enlarged thy bound: and a man shall not desire thy land in thy coming up to see the face of Jehovah thy God, three times in the year.

25.text: Thou shalt not slaughter upon leaven, the blood of my sacrifice; and the sacrifice of the festival of the pass over shall not be left to morning.

26.text: The first of the first fruits of thy land thou shalt bring to the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid in his mother’s milk.

27.text: And Jehovah will say to Moses, Write to thyself these words; for upon the mouth of these words, I made a covenant with thee and with Israel.

28.text: And he will be there with Jehovah forty days and forty nights; he ate not bread and drank not water. And he will write upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten words.

29.text: And it shall be in Moses’ coming down from the mount Sinai (and the two tables of testimony in. Moses’ hand in his coming down from the mount) and Moses knew not that the skin of his face shone in his speaking with him.

30.text: And Aaron and all the sons of Israel will see Moses, and behold, the skin of his face shone; and they will fear coming near to him.

31.text: And Moses will call to them; and Aaron and all the chiefs of the assembly will turn back to him: and Moses will speak to them.

32.text: And after this all the sons of Israel drew near: and he will command them all what Jehovah spake to him in mount Sinai.

33.text: And Moses will finish speaking to them and he will give a vail upon his face.

34.text: And in Moses’ going in before Jehovah to speak with him, he will turn away the covering till his coming out And he will come forth and speak to the sons of Israel what will be commanded.

35.text: And the sons of Israel saw the face of Moses that the skin of Moses’ face shone: and Moses turned back the vail upon his face till his going in to speak with him.
